official_title: Extended-Field Lymph Node Proton Irradiation for High Risk Prostate Cancer
brief_title: Proton Radiation Therapy for the Treatment of Patients with High Risk Prostate Cancer
cancer_type_display: A study of proton radiation therapy for patients with high-risk or lymph node positive prostate cancer.
cancer_tags: Stage III Prostate Cancer AJCC V8
Stage IIIA Prostate Cancer AJCC V8
Stage IIIB Prostate Cancer AJCC V8
Stage IIIC Prostate Cancer AJCC V8
prior_treatments_excluded: Prior radiotherapy to the region of the study cancer
key_inclusion_summary: Pathologically confirmed high-risk prostate cancer (Gleason grade ≥ 8, cT3b/cT4, PSA > 20, or positive regional lymph nodes).
Adequate blood counts (ANC ≥ 1,500 cells/mm³, Platelets ≥ 100,000 cells/mm³, Hemoglobin ≥ 8.0 g/dl).
Able to provide study-specific informed consent.
key_exclusion_summary: Presence of bone or distant lymph node metastasis.
Previous radical surgery (prostatectomy) or cryosurgery for prostate cancer.
Prior radiotherapy to the region of the study cancer that would result in overlap of radiation fields.
Uncontrolled intercurrent illness, including inflammatory bowel disease.
